worldofzuul

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • worldofzuul.Inventory

  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles inventory and handles items. Contains the limits on how big an inventory is.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.UUID> inventoryList
      Next is the declaration of the ArrayList witch will be the structure for the inventory.
      private int maxAllowedItems
      Following are the two parameters for the inventory that can be set when constructed.
      private int maxAllowedWeight 
      private int sumItems
      The inventory will have some values about how many items there are in it, the cummulated weight, a unique ID number for each item, (maybe more to come).
      private int sumWeight 
      private java.util.UUID uuid 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Inventory()
      Constructor without setting limits on the inventory, which means it uses the default.
      Inventory(int maxItems, int maxWeight)
      Inventory constructs a inventory with the possibility to set maximum weight the player is allowed to carry and the maximum amount of items allowed to carry.

    • Field Detail

      • inventoryList

        private final java.util.ArrayList<java.util.UUID> inventoryList
        Next is the declaration of the ArrayList witch will be the structure for the inventory. (Adding/removing items etc)

      • maxAllowedItems

        private int maxAllowedItems
        Following are the two parameters for the inventory that can be set when constructed. But if the class is constructed without them being set, it will fall back to these predefined values: maxAllowedItems with default 3 maxAllowedWeight with default 12

      • maxAllowedWeight

        private int maxAllowedWeight

      • sumItems

        private int sumItems
        The inventory will have some values about how many items there are in it, the cummulated weight, a unique ID number for each item, (maybe more to come). These attributes will be declared here:

      • sumWeight

        private int sumWeight

      • uuid

        private java.util.UUID uuid

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory(int maxItems,
                 int maxWeight)
        Inventory constructs a inventory with the possibility to set maximum weight the player is allowed to carry and the maximum amount of items allowed to carry. If no values are given, the defaults will be used.
        Parameters:
        maxItems - set max allowed amount of items in integers default is 3.
        maxWeight - set max allowed weight in integers, default is 12.

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Constructor without setting limits on the inventory, which means it uses the default.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxItems

        public int getMaxItems()
        getMaxItems returns the maximum amount of items allowed to carry.
        Returns:
        maximum amount of items allowed in integers.

      • setMaxItems

        public void setMaxItems(int x)
        setMaxItems sets the max amount of items allowed to carry.
        Parameters:
        x - int for setting maxAllowedItems

      • getMaxWeight

        public int getMaxWeight()
        getMaxWeight returns the maximum cumulated weight allowed to carry.
        Returns:
        maximum cumulated weight allowed in integers.

      • setMaxWeight

        public void setMaxWeight(int x)
        setMaxWeight set the max cumulated weight allowed to carry.
        Parameters:
        x - int for setting maxAllowedWeight

      • addItem

        public boolean addItem(java.util.UUID uuid,
                       int weight)
        addItem adds a item, of type Item, to the inventory. TODO: There needs a destination too.. The uniqID could be implemented better in regards of how to remove items again.
        Parameters:
        uuid -
        weight - Set the weight of the item (int).
        Returns:
        returns the UUID number for the added item.

      • remItem

        public void remItem(java.util.UUID uuid,
                    int weight)
        remItem removes a given item from the inventory, based upon the unique ID returned from the addItem method. TODO: better implementation in regards to uniqID and idendifying items.
        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID of item to be deleted.
        weight -
